required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tourniquet vs. Short Time Tourniquet in Primary Robotic Assisted TKA
clinical_study.official_title: Is TKA With Short Tourniquet Time Superior to TKA With Tourniquet Use in Primary Robotic Assisted TKA? A Prospective, Randomized Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this prospective, randomized study is to compare the outcomes of patients undergoing Robotic Arm-Assisted TKA (RA-TKA) with the intraoperative use of a tourniquet to those undergoing RA-TKA with a short tourniquet time.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this prospective, randomized study is to compare the outcomes of patients undergoing Robotic Arm-Assisted TKA (RA-TKA) with the intraoperative use of a tourniquet to those undergoing RA-TKA with a short tourniquet time. The primary objectives will be to compare the total duration of hospital stay, quadriceps function, and the amount of postoperative narcotics utilized and VAS pain levels. The secondary objective will be to compare variables of patient functionality at five postoperative intervals.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken preoperatively (4-6 weeks prior to date of surgery)
primary_outcome.description: Knee Society Score. The score is on a scale from 0-100. A higher value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 6 weeks (± 2 weeks) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Knee Society Score. The score is on a scale from 0-100. A higher value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 1 year (± 2 months) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Knee Society Score. The score is on a scale from 0-100. A higher value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken preoperatively (4-6 weeks prior to date of surgery)
primary_outcome.description: WOMAC score. The score is on a scale from 0-100. In contrast to the Knee Society Score, on the WOMAC a lower value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 6 weeks (± 2 weeks) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: WOMAC score. The score is on a scale from 0-100. In contrast to the Knee Society Score, on the WOMAC a lower value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 1 year (± 2 months) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: WOMAC score. The score is on a scale from 0-100. In contrast to the Knee Society Score, on the WOMAC a lower value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken preoperatively (4-6 weeks prior to date of surgery)
primary_outcome.description: Active ROM (range-of-motion) as measured by a goniometer (range of 0-135 degrees)

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 6 weeks (± 2 weeks) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Active ROM (range-of-motion) as measured by a goniometer (range of 0-135 degrees)

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 1 year (± 2 months) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Active ROM (range-of-motion) as measured by a goniometer (range of 0-135 degrees)

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 24 hours postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Amount of narcotic medication utilized (daily dosage measured as a Milligram Morphine Equivalent (MME) value).

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 48 hours postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Amount of narcotic medication utilized (daily dosage measured as a Milligram Morphine Equivalent (MME) value).

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 72 hours postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Amount of narcotic medication utilized (daily dosage measured as a Milligram Morphine Equivalent (MME) value).

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 2 weeks (± 4 days) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Amount of narcotic medication utilized (daily dosage measured as a Milligram Morphine Equivalent (MME) value).

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 6 weeks (± 2 weeks) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Amount of narcotic medication utilized (daily dosage measured as a Milligram Morphine Equivalent (MME) value).

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 24 hours postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scale measures the patient's level of knee pain on a scale of zero to ten via what the patient expresses verbally. The Visual Analog Scale (VAS) represents the degree of pain that the patient is experiencing at the time the measure is taken. Zero represents "pain-free". A 10 would represent pain so excruciating as to warrant emergency medical assistance, or as it is described to the patient, "the worst pain imaginable". Obviously, the lower the number, the better the outcome. There is no subscale.

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 48 hours postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scale measures the patient's level of knee pain on a scale of zero to ten via what the patient expresses verbally. The Visual Analog Scale (VAS) represents the degree of pain that the patient is experiencing at the time the measure is taken. Zero represents "pain-free". A 10 would represent pain so excruciating as to warrant emergency medical assistance, or as it is described to the patient, "the worst pain imaginable". Obviously, the lower the number, the better the outcome. There is no subscale.

The Visual Analog Scale (VAS) represents the degree of pain that the patient is experiencing at the time the measure is taken. Zero represents "pain-free". A 10 would represent pain so excruciating as to warrant emergency medical assistance, or as it is described to the patient, "the worst pain imaginable". Obviously, the lower the number, the better the outcome. There is no subscale.

primary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scale measures the patient's level of knee pain on a scale of zero to ten via what the patient expresses verbally. A 10 would represent pain so excruciating as to warrant emergency medical assistance, or as it is described to the patient, "the worst pain imaginable". Obviously, the lower the number, the better the outcome. There is no subscale.

The Visual Analog Scale (VAS) represents the degree of pain that the patient is experiencing at the time the measure is taken. Zero represents "pain-free". primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 2 weeks (± 4 days)
primary_outcome.description: Quadriceps Function as measured in peak force in kilograms by a Hand-held dynamometer (model 01163; Lafayette Instrument Company, Lafayette, Ind., USA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 6 weeks (± 2 weeks) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Quadriceps Function as measured in peak force in kilograms by a Hand-held dynamometer (model 01163; Lafayette Instrument Company, Lafayette, Ind., USA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 1 year (± 2 months) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Quadriceps Function as measured in peak force in kilograms by a Hand-held dynamometer (model 01163; Lafayette Instrument Company, Lafayette, Ind., USA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 2 weeks postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: total length of hospital stay as defined by number of days from date of surgery to date of discharge

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 2 weeks (± 4 days) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Dates of postoperative exams as defined by dates that subject returns to the P.I.'s office for postoperative exam

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 6 weeks (± 2 weeks) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Dates of postoperative exams as defined by dates that subject returns to the P.I.'s office for postoperative exam

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken 1 year (± 2 months) postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Dates of postoperative exams as defined by dates that subject returns to the P.I.'s office for postoperative exam

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 2 weeks postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of postop transfusion as defined by one or more transfusions of blood to the subject postoperatively

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measures will be taken preoperatively (4-6 weeks prior to date of surgery) and on postoperative day number two.
primary_outcome.description: Change in CKMB (creatinine level) as defined by the CKMB values recorded in the participant's lab report

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measures will be taken preoperatively (4-6 weeks prior to date of surgery) and on postoperative day number two.
primary_outcome.description: Change in HgB as defined by the HgB values recorded in the participant's lab report

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 2 weeks postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Total Operative Time as defined in minutes

primary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 2 weeks postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Estimated Blood Loss as defined by the amount of intraoperative blood loss measured in cubic centimeters (cc).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with postoperative complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: outcome measure will be taken at 1 year (± 2 months) postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with postoperative complications. A postoperative complication is defined as any diagnosis or condition that necessitates a re-operation on the surgical knee

arm_group.arm_group_label: A - TKA with short tourniquet time
arm_group.description: 50 arms: subjects will receive a tourniquet with a short tourniquet time during TKA surgery. Short tourniquet time is defined in this study as the release of the tourniquet after the initial exposure, resulting in a total tourniquet time of only 10-15 minutes.
50 arms: subjects will receive a tourniquet during TKA surgery.

intervention.intervention_name: Primary Robotic-Assisted Total Knee Arthroplasty with a short tourniquet time
intervention.description: Primary Robotic-Assisted Total Knee Arthroplasty with a short tourniquet time. Short tourniquet time is defined in this study as the release of the tourniquet after the initial exposure, resulting in a total tourniquet time of only 10-15 minutes.
intervention.arm_group_label: A - TKA with short tourniquet time

intervention.intervention_name: Primary Robotic-Assisted Total Knee Arthroplasty with the use of a tourniquet
intervention.description: Primary Robotic-Assisted Total Knee Arthroplasty with the use of a tourniquet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient is over the age of 21
2. Patient is scheduled to undergo a unilateral, cementless primary RA-TKA, secondary to osteoarthritis
3. Surgical approach is subvastus approach
4. Patient's BMI (body mass index) is less than 40 at time of surgery.
5. Patient agrees to participate as a study subject and signs the Informed Consent and Research Authorization documents
6. Patient is able to read and speak English
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient is under the age of 21
2. Patient's primary diagnosis is not osteoarthritis (e.g. post-traumatic arthritis)
3. Patient is scheduled to undergo a bilateral TKA surgery
4. Patient BMI is > 40
5. Patient is unable to read and speak English
